intro: Campanula lyrata, commonly known as the lyrical bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Campanula lyrata thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
